summary: The concept of "video game console," categorized under social affairs, is redirected to the preferred term "electronic game." In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, electronic games encompass various interactive entertainment devices, including video game consoles. These devices are subject to regulations concerning consumer protection, intellectual property rights, and digital content distribution. The EU aims to ensure that electronic games meet safety standards and promote fair competition within the digital market. By redirecting to "electronic game," the focus shifts to a broader understanding of interactive entertainment, facilitating comprehensive regulatory oversight and policy development in this rapidly evolving sector.
